messages.title: Strong & Stable Leadership
messages.content: In contrast to a coalition of chaos under Jeremy Corbyn, Theresa May offers strong and stable leadership in the national interest.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Theresa May is positioned as the only candidate who can secure the best Brexit deal for Britain.

The campaign emphasizes economic security, suggesting that the alternative could lead to a coalition with no control on immigration, chaos in parliament, and the SNP calling shots on Brexit and tax rises.

mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: Jeremy Corbyn, Tim Farron, Paul Nuttall
mentions.tacticalSituation: Coalition of chaos under Jeremy Corbyn, nationalists and the adoption of inaccurate policies.

issues.brexitEurope: Theresa May aims to secure the best Brexit deal for Britain, contrasting with the uncertainty of Brexit negotiations under Jeremy Corbyn.
issues.economy: Economic security is highlighted, with a focus on avoiding the chaos of a coalition that has no control on immigration and may lead to tax rises.
issues.governance: The leaflet implies that governance under Theresa May offers strong and stable leadership, while governance under her opponents would lead to a hung parliament and chaos.
issues.immigration: Immigration control is presented as under threat if Theresa May is not elected.

contactInformation.address: CCHQ, 4 Matthew Parker Street, London, SW1H 9HQ

quotes.text: Your local vote on Thursday will decide who is Prime Minister on Friday, leading our Brexit negotiations when they start just 11 days after you vote â€“ Theresa May or Jeremy Corbyn.

images.caption: Leaflet images comparing the consequences of voting for Theresa May and other candidates such as Jeremy Corbyn, Tim Farron, and Paul Nuttall.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet portrays a stark contrast between voting for Theresa May, who is associated with 'strong & stable leadership,' and her opponents who are linked to 'uncertain Brexit' and 'chaos.'
